note.p: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal (Bibliothèque nationale de France), 3337
Sully-sur-Loire, France (known from colophon on f.123r)
Gothic, written in 2 columns of 45 lines, 1 scribe
1 empty space of 24 lines left for opening miniature and blue and red penwork ‘M’ (f. 1r). Smaller blue initials with red pen-florishing and red initials with brown pen-florishing.
296 x 213 mm (this measurement is from Langlois)
French; brown calf binding with gilt fillet borders on covers, raised spine bands, gilt ornaments on spine, red leather spine labels with gilt lettering, marbled endpapers.

Charles d’Albret, comte de Dreux (d. 1415), early 15th century (colophon on f. 123r: “Cy faut le rommans de la rose, Ou l’art d’amours est toute enclose. L’an mil. ccc.IIIIxx dis Fu ce rommans ycy escrips. A suly le chastel sur loire…[erasure]”); André Sevin? (name written on ff. 123v and 124r, “Ce liure est a Andre Seuin qui le trouuera, cy luy rendre”; Marc Antoine René de Voyer d’Argenson, marquis de Paulmy (1722-1787), 18th century ("Paulmy" written at the bottom of f. 1r); stamps of Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal on ff. 1r, 122v, 123r.
Latin glosses (proverbial sayings and citations from Ovid) added by 3 hands (1 is the scribe)
1. Henry Martin, Catalogue des manuscrits de la bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, III, p. 336
3. Sylvia Huot, The Romance of the Rose and its medieval readers: interpretation, reception, manuscript transmission (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1993), pp. 27, 55-58.
This description has been compiled using the site's images and various published sources. If you have corrections or additional information on the manuscript, please do contact us.
